intro: Balizia pedicellaris, commonly known as the yellow starling pea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Balizia pedicellaris is also known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it an important plant in soil enrichment.
